stacks.name: Docker (Standard)
stacks.description: Standard Docker Engine installation with Compose
stacks.llm_context: Standard Docker CE installation. Add user to docker group. Includes Compose plugin.

stacks.name: Docker for Development
stacks.description: Docker optimized for local development workflows
stacks.llm_context: Docker for development. Configure with bind mounts for hot reload. Include docker-compose.override.yml for dev settings.

stacks.name: Docker with NVIDIA GPU
stacks.description: Docker with NVIDIA Container Toolkit for GPU workloads
stacks.llm_context: Docker with NVIDIA runtime. Configure nvidia as default runtime. Test with: docker run --rm --gpus all nvidia/cuda:12.0-base nvidia-smi

stacks.name: Docker for CI/CD
stacks.description: Docker setup optimized for CI/CD pipelines
stacks.llm_context: Docker for CI/CD. Use multi-stage builds. Configure buildx for multi-platform. Cache layers effectively.

stacks.name: Docker for Python Projects
stacks.description: Docker environment optimized for Python development
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Python. Use python:3.11-slim base image. Include requirements.txt. Use multi-stage builds for smaller images.

stacks.name: Docker for Node.js Apps
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Node.js. Use node:20-alpine base. Copy package*.json first for layer caching. Use npm ci for reproducible builds.

stacks.name: Docker for Java Services
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Java. Use eclipse-temurin:21-jre-alpine for runtime. Multi-stage build with maven for compilation. Set JVM memory limits.

stacks.name: Docker for Go Services
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Go. Use multi-stage: golang:1.22 for build, scratch or distroless for runtime. Static binary with CGO_ENABLED=0.

stacks.name: Docker for Microservices
stacks.llm_context: Docker for microservices. Use docker-compose for local, consider Kubernetes for production. Implement health checks. Use networks for isolation.

stacks.name: Docker for Local Testing
stacks.description: Docker setup for local testing and QA
stacks.llm_context: Docker for testing. Use testcontainers pattern. Ephemeral containers for each test run. Clean up with docker-compose down -v.

stacks.name: Docker for ML Workloads
stacks.description: Docker optimized for machine learning workflows
stacks.llm_context: Docker for ML. Use nvidia/cuda base images. Mount data volumes. Set --shm-size for PyTorch. Consider NGC containers.

stacks.name: Docker for Data Engineering
stacks.description: Docker setup for data pipelines and ETL
stacks.llm_context: Docker for data engineering. Containerize ETL jobs. Use volumes for data. Consider Airflow for orchestration.

stacks.name: Docker for Web Hosting
stacks.description: Docker setup for hosting web applications
stacks.llm_context: Docker for web hosting. Use Traefik or nginx-proxy for routing. SSL with Let's Encrypt. Implement resource limits.

stacks.name: Docker with Compose
stacks.description: Docker with focus on multi-container Compose workflows
stacks.llm_context: Docker Compose for multi-container apps. Use profiles for optional services. Override files for environments. Named volumes for persistence.

stacks.name: Docker for Dev Containers
stacks.description: Docker setup for VS Code Dev Containers
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Dev Containers. Create .devcontainer/devcontainer.json. Use mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers base images. Mount SSH keys.

stacks.name: Docker for ARM Systems
stacks.llm_context: Docker for ARM. Use multi-platform builds with buildx. Check image ARM support. Build with --platform linux/arm64.

stacks.name: Docker for Raspberry Pi
stacks.description: Docker setup for Raspberry Pi devices
stacks.llm_context: Docker for Raspberry Pi. Use arm32v7 or arm64v8 images. Limit memory with --memory flag. Consider Portainer for management.

stacks.name: Docker for Edge Devices
stacks.llm_context: Docker for edge devices. Use alpine-based images. Implement offline registry. Consider k3s for orchestration.

stacks.name: Docker Hardened Setup
stacks.llm_context: Hardened Docker. Enable content trust, user namespaces, seccomp profiles. No privileged containers. Read-only root filesystem. Drop capabilities.

stacks.name: Docker Rootless Mode
stacks.llm_context: Rootless Docker. Run dockerd as non-root. Set DOCKER_HOST. Some limitations with networking and storage drivers.

stacks.name: Docker with Monitoring
stacks.llm_context: Docker with monitoring. Deploy cAdvisor for container metrics. Prometheus for collection. Grafana for dashboards. Use Docker labels for discovery.

stacks.name: Docker Logging Stack
stacks.llm_context: Docker logging stack. Use Loki + Promtail for lightweight logging. Or ELK for full-featured. Configure log drivers.

stacks.name: Docker with Reverse Proxy
stacks.description: Docker with automatic reverse proxy and SSL
stacks.llm_context: Docker reverse proxy. Use Traefik or nginx-proxy. Auto SSL with Let's Encrypt. Label-based routing. Expose ports 80 and 443 only on proxy.

stacks.name: Docker + PostgreSQL
stacks.llm_context: Docker PostgreSQL. Use named volume for data persistence. Set POSTGRES_PASSWORD. Use pg_isready for health checks.

stacks.name: Docker + Redis
stacks.llm_context: Docker Redis. Use redis:alpine for smaller image. Configure maxmemory and eviction policy. Persist with AOF or RDB.

stacks.name: Docker + MySQL
stacks.llm_context: Docker MySQL. Use named volume for /var/lib/mysql. Set MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD. Consider mysql_native_password for compatibility.

stacks.name: Docker + MongoDB
stacks.llm_context: Docker MongoDB. Use named volume for /data/db. Set MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME and MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD. Use mongo-express for GUI.

stacks.name: MongoDB Server
stacks.llm_context: MongoDB native install. Add MongoDB repo first. Configure bindIp for remote access. Enable authentication for production.

stacks.name: Node.js + MongoDB Stack
stacks.llm_context: Node.js with MongoDB using Mongoose ODM. Use connection pooling. Implement proper error handling for database operations.

stacks.name: Python + MongoDB Stack
stacks.llm_context: Python with MongoDB using PyMongo or Motor (async). Use connection pooling. Motor for async FastAPI apps.

stacks.name: Docker + NGINX
stacks.llm_context: Docker NGINX. Mount config to /etc/nginx/conf.d/. Use volumes for static files. Configure upstream for app servers.

stacks.name: Docker + Traefik
stacks.llm_context: Docker Traefik. Enable Docker provider. Use labels for routing. Configure Let's Encrypt for auto SSL. Dashboard at :8080.

stacks.name: Docker for Airflow
stacks.llm_context: Docker Airflow. Use official docker-compose from Airflow docs. Configure executor (Local, Celery, Kubernetes). Mount DAGs folder.

stacks.name: Docker for Spark
stacks.llm_context: Docker Spark. Use bitnami/spark for easy setup. Configure master and workers. Mount data volumes. Set memory limits.

stacks.name: Docker for Kafka
stacks.llm_context: Docker Kafka. Use KRaft mode (no Zookeeper) for new setups. Or Bitnami images with Zookeeper. Configure listeners for external access.

stacks.name: Docker for ELK
stacks.description: Docker setup for Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana
stacks.llm_context: Docker ELK stack. Set vm.max_map_count=262144. Use xpack.security for auth. Kibana at :5601. Consider OpenSearch as alternative.

stacks.name: Docker for FastAPI
stacks.llm_context: Docker FastAPI. Use python:3.11-slim. Run with uvicorn --host 0.0.0.0. Multi-stage build for smaller image.

stacks.name: Docker for Django
stacks.llm_context: Docker Django. Use gunicorn for production. Collect static files in build. Configure DATABASE_URL from env. Run migrations on startup.

stacks.name: Docker for Flask
stacks.llm_context: Docker Flask. Use gunicorn for production. Set FLASK_APP env var. Use gevent or eventlet for async.

stacks.name: Docker for Rails
stacks.description: Docker optimized for Ruby on Rails
stacks.llm_context: Docker Rails. Use ruby:3.2-slim. Bundle install with cache. Precompile assets. Run with puma. Configure database.yml from env.

stacks.name: Docker for Laravel
stacks.description: Docker optimized for Laravel PHP framework
stacks.llm_context: Docker Laravel. Use php:8.2-fpm with nginx. Install composer dependencies. Set APP_KEY. Configure queue worker container.

stacks.name: Docker for WordPress
stacks.llm_context: Docker WordPress. Use official wordpress image. Pair with MySQL/MariaDB. Mount wp-content for persistence. Configure with env vars.

stacks.name: Docker for Next.js
stacks.llm_context: Docker Next.js. Use standalone output mode. Multi-stage build: deps, builder, runner. Copy .next/standalone. Set HOSTNAME=0.0.0.0.

stacks.name: Docker for React Apps
stacks.llm_context: Docker React. Multi-stage: node for build, nginx for serve. Build static files, copy to nginx html dir. Configure nginx for SPA routing.

stacks.name: Python Development Environment
stacks.description: Complete Python development setup with tools and linting
stacks.llm_context: Python dev environment. Install linters, formatters, type checkers. Configure pyproject.toml for tool settings.

stacks.name: Python Web Backend
stacks.llm_context: Python web backend. Choose framework (Django/FastAPI/Flask). Use gunicorn/uvicorn for production.

stacks.name: Python REST API
stacks.description: Python setup for building REST APIs
stacks.llm_context: Python REST API. FastAPI recommended for modern APIs. Include auth with JWT. Use Pydantic for validation.

stacks.name: Python FastAPI Stack

stacks.llm_context: FastAPI stack. Async Python framework. Auto OpenAPI docs at /docs. Use dependency injection. Pydantic for models.

stacks.name: Python Django Stack
stacks.description: Full-featured Django web framework with batteries included
stacks.llm_context: Django stack. Batteries included framework. Use DRF for APIs. Celery for async tasks. PostgreSQL recommended.

stacks.name: Python Flask Stack
stacks.llm_context: Flask micro-framework. Minimal and flexible. Add extensions as needed. Use gunicorn for production.

stacks.name: Python ML Environment
stacks.llm_context: Python ML environment. Scikit-learn for classical ML. Use MLflow for experiment tracking. Jupyter for exploration.

stacks.llm_context: Python data science. Pandas for data manipulation. Matplotlib/Seaborn for visualization. Jupyter for notebooks.

stacks.name: Python Jupyter Lab
stacks.llm_context: JupyterLab environment. Run with jupyter lab --ip=0.0.0.0. Install extensions for Git, widgets. Use voila for dashboards.

stacks.llm_context: GPU ML stack. Install PyTorch with CUDA. Check GPU with torch.cuda.is_available(). Use mixed precision for speed.

stacks.llm_context: Python NLP. SpaCy for pipelines. Transformers for BERT/GPT models. Download spacy models with python -m spacy download.

stacks.llm_context: Python automation. Use schedule for cron-like jobs. Fabric for SSH tasks. Invoke for task running.

stacks.llm_context: Python async. Use asyncio event loop. aiohttp for async HTTP. Avoid blocking calls in async code.

stacks.llm_context: Python microservices. FastAPI per service. Use message queues. Implement health checks. OpenTelemetry for tracing.

stacks.llm_context: Python serverless. Use Mangum for FastAPI on Lambda. Keep packages small. Use layers for dependencies.

stacks.name: Python ETL Pipeline
stacks.llm_context: Python ETL. Pandas for transforms. SQLAlchemy for DB connections. Prefect/Airflow for orchestration.

stacks.llm_context: Apache Airflow. Initialize DB with airflow db init. Create admin user. Define DAGs in dags/ folder.
